nodes.text: the problems here flow out of its having tried to proceed according to the most universally accepted standards available to it.
if it has tried to proceed according to the Constitution doing so will have caused problems
It has tried to proceed in accordance with the Constitution

If the government's interests in not allowing Moussaoui to talk to Binalshibi are real and there is no question that the defense could have access to such a witness according to the Constitution then if it has tried to proceed according to the Constitution doing so will have caused problems
Under normal circumstances there would be no question that the defense could have access to such a witness -- nor constitutionally speaking should there be such question now.
the government's other interests here are very real.
The Sixth Amendment makes clear that  the accused shall enjoy the right . . . to have compulsory process for obtaining witnesses in his favor.

If the Sixth Amendment makes clear that  the accused shall enjoy the right...to have compulsory process for obtaining witnesses in his favor  and admits no national security exception and the defense argues that Binalshibh's testimony would be in his favor then according to the constitution there should be no question that the defense could have access to such a witness.
Mr. Binalshibh's testimony the defense argues would lessen a jury's sense of Mr. Moussaoui's culpability and make it less inclined to impose the death penalty.

The Constitution's language is absolute after all and admits no national security exception. Fair-trial rights in American courts cannot be contingent on other governmental interests even pressing ones.

Mr. Moussaoui is representing himself meaning that he would personally talk to a terrorist confederate in any deposition. It isn't unreasonable for the government to regard this as an unacceptable risk.

If Moussaoui would personally talk to a terrorist confederate and this is not unreasonably regarded as an unacceptable risk the government's interests in not allowing Moussaoui to talk to Binalshibh are very real
